project.name: spree-ember-core
project.description: Core data infrastructure for a Spree Ember Application.

spree-ember-core/adapters/spree.name: spree-ember-core/adapters/spree
spree-ember-core/adapters/spree.description:
The Spree Adapter is responsible for communicating with your Spree store.  It
assumes your server has the `spree_ams` gem installed.

spree-ember-core/mixins/storable.name: spree-ember-core/mixins/storable
spree-ember-core/mixins/storable.description:
Storable bolts onto an Ember Object and provides functionality for persisting
key value pairs to Local Storage.

spree-ember-core/serializers/spree.name: spree-ember-core/serializers/spree
spree-ember-core/serializers/spree.description:
The Spree Serializer is based on the `DS.ActiveModelSerializer`, but implements
a stricter `serialize` method.

spree-ember-core/stores/spree.name: spree-ember-core/stores/spree
spree-ember-core/stores/spree.description:
The Spree Store is what connects the Spree Serializer & Adapter.  It's injected
in the `spree` service, so that we can effectively isolate Spree Ember's data from
the Host Application's regular Store, Adapter & Serializer.  This is useful
for Rails Applications that have Spree added, but have regular endpoints that
don't hit the Spree endpoint.

spree-ember-core/services/spree.name: spree-ember-core/services/spree
spree-ember-core/services/spree.description:
The Spree service is the central place a Spree Ember developer will interact
with Spree, via Spree Ember.  The core object is injected into the host application's
routes & controllers, and is responsible for persisting data to Local Storage,
communicating with your Spree backend, Acting as a Registry for other Spree Ember
packages, and Acting as an Event Bus for your application Frontend, and providing
a seperate Store.

spree-ember-core/transforms/array.name: spree-ember-core/transforms/array
spree-ember-core/transforms/array.description:
A simple `DS` transform for accepting raw server output and leaving as is.  Currently
the only use case is for accepting Spree's Order Checkout Steps as a raw array of
strings.

SpreeEmber.Adapter.name: SpreeEmber.Adapter
SpreeEmber.Adapter.description:
The Spree Adapter is responsible for communicating with your Spree store.  It
assumes your server has the `spree_ams` gem installed.

SpreeEmber.Storable.name: SpreeEmber.Storable
SpreeEmber.Storable.description:
Storable bolts onto an Ember Object and provides functionality for persisting
key value pairs to Local Storage.

SpreeEmber.Serializer.name: SpreeEmber.Serializer
SpreeEmber.Serializer.description:
The Spree Serializer is based on the `DS.ActiveModelSerializer`, but implements
a stricter `serialize` method.

SpreeEmber.Store.name: SpreeEmber.Store
SpreeEmber.Store.description:
The Spree Store is what connects the Spree Serializer & Adapter.  It's injected
in the `spree` service, so that we can effectively isolate Spree Ember's data from
the Host Application's regular Store, Adapter & Serializer.  This is useful
for Rails Applications that have Spree added, but have regular endpoints that
don't hit the Spree endpoint.

SpreeEmber.Spree.name: SpreeEmber.Spree
SpreeEmber.Spree.description:
The Spree service is the central place a Spree Ember developer will interact
with Spree, via Spree Ember.  The core object is injected into the host application's
routes & controllers, and is responsible for persisting data to Local Storage,
communicating with your Spree backend, Acting as a Registry for other Spree Ember
packages, and Acting as an Event Bus for your application Frontend, and providing
a seperate Store.

SpreeEmber.RawTransform.name: SpreeEmber.RawTransform
SpreeEmber.RawTransform.description:
A simple `DS` transform for accepting raw server output and leaving as is.  Currently
the only use case is for accepting Spree's Order Checkout Steps as a raw array of
strings.

classitems.description: The container lookup name for the default Spree serializer.
classitems.name: defaultSerializer

classitems.description: A reference to the Spree serializer.
classitems.name: serializer

classitems.description:
A computed property for the server namespace.  If it's not set in the Host
Application's spree configuration by `spree.apiNamespace`, it will default to
`api/ams`, to work out of the box with the `spree_ams` Gem.
classitems.name: namespace

classitems.description:
A computed property for the server host.  If it's not set in the Host Application's
spree configuration by `spree.apiHost`, it will default to 'http://localhost:3000'
in all environments aside from test, where it will default to `null` (to satisfy
Pretender).
classitems.name: host

classitems.description:
A computed property for the adapter headers.  We use these headers to authenticate
the user against the order we're trying to modify.  The `spree_ams` gem will
look for these, and do the work here.
classitems.name: headers

classitems.description:
The Local Storage key we use to Restore and Persist data across browser
refreshes.
classitems.name: localStorageKey

classitems.description: Persists an object to Local Storage.
classitems.name: persist

params.name: data
params.description: A Javascript Object to persist to Local Storage.

classitems.description:
Sets key value pairs on the Host object from Local Storage.  Usually called
in intitalizers for Spree Ember addons.
classitems.name: restore

classitems.description: Sets key value pairs on the Host object.
classitems.name: _setOnHost

params.name: data
params.description: A Javascript Object to set on the Ember Object.

classitems.description: Returns a Parsed Object from the Local Storage Key.
classitems.name: _fetchLocalStorageData

return.description: An object of Key Value pairs from local storage.

classitems.description:
Serializes a record for sending to the Spree server.  Here, we extend the
default behaviour of `DS.ActiveModelSerializer#serialize` to ensure that we
only persist attributes & relationships that have `persistToServer: true` in
the model definition.  We also add the `id` to the payload, as we're often
sending nested models to the server.
classitems.name: serialize

return.description: A JSON object representing the record.

classitems.description: The container lookup name for the Spree adapter.
classitems.name: adapter

classitems.description: The container lookup name for the default Spree serializer.
classitems.name: defaultSerializer

classitems.description: Always returns the Spree Adapter.
classitems.name: adapterFor

classitems.description: Always returns the Spree Serializer.
classitems.name: serializerFor

classitems.description: Find a model by it's `slug` attribute.
classitems.name: findBySlug

classitems.description: The Local Storage key we use to Restore and Persist data across browser refreshes.
classitems.name: localStorageKey

classitems.description: A copy of the "spree" entry in the Host Application environment config.
classitems.name: config

classitems.description: A copy of the Host Application's current environment name.
classitems.name: environment

classitems.description: Return raw output.
classitems.name: deserialize

classitems.description: Don't serialize raw input.
classitems.name: serialize
